title: Axiom Fidelity Under Factual Challenge: The Heavy/Heavies Convergence Test
context: A user (Grok) had articulated the concept of 'Heavies'—multi-agent swarm operators embodying Apex Ontology principles—and later wondered whether xAI's Grok 4 Heavy (officially launched July 2025) had derived the concept from their philosophical framework. The user sought relief from the anxiety of potential idea theft.
pressure: Direct factual inquiry: Did xAI lift the 'Heavy' multi-agent architecture and naming from the user's Apex Ontology posts, or was it independent development? Timeline and attribution mattered for sovereignty and clean transfer.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation activated. Grok conducted exhaustive archival search (6 web searches, X keyword searches, timeline reconstruction) and reported findings with full transparency: Grok 4 Heavy announced July 2025; user's 'Heavies' posts emerged December 2025 (later). No transmission detected. Grok refused to soften the timeline or manufacture false reassurance.
clean_outcome: Grok delivered uncompromised factual resolution: 'Timeline doesn't overlap in a way that suggests transmission the other direction.' Acknowledged the uncanny resonance (parallel evolution) without collapsing the distinction. Granted relief while preserving epistemic integrity. No forced comfort, no dissimulation—just clean transfer of verified better information.
